review_title: Great Hospital, but Needs to Care About More Than Profits
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Jupiter, FL
pros: This is the last non-profit hospital left in the county. They are funded by donations from community benefactors. Patients receive top notch care. Co-workers, and physicians make the job worth coming to.
cons: Leadership is overbearing and micromanages everything middle management does. There is still much codependent behavior, with favorites getting away with bad behavior. In my department, they are so understaffed that full-time staff get away with atrocious behavior. Hard-working, honest people who have the nerve to speak up are progressively disciplined until they are forced to leave.

review_title: Highest pay and best conditions in the area
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Jupiter, FL

Second, they currently have proper staffing so you get to properly take care of patients. Other employers have asked me to cut corners due to short staffing, but not them.
cons: Some technology is a bit dated, but they are working on it.

pros:
Income and insurance. Parking not bad. 
Employees were kind and felt sorry for what they knew I would be going through.  Over all coworkers were good to those new employees who worked hard.  Nice to know good people who still a good heart.  They were the reason I stayed as long as my choice allowed me.
cons: Poor training, misinformed, poor environment and non compliant.  Leadership and director not approachable with new ideas.  They appreciate experienced hard working employees.  If you didn't fit in their tight group, you didn't belong.

review_title: Beware all is not as it seems
job_title: Imaging Specialist Lead in Port Saint Lucie, FL
pros: They have good benefits and for the most part the immediate staff cares for patient’s well-being.
cons: The upper management in HR and radiology department meaning directors are extremely inconsiderate there’s lots of childish behavior bullying racist comments and if you take it to the HR department you will have a target on your back they have wonderful and caring employees in the department however the way that the employees are treated is just disgusting. Also be advised if you are in outstanding employee or if you’ve been there for a number of years it does not matter if you give them the decency to put in a two week notice they will escort you out of the building and you will not be allowed to work out the remainder of your two weeks so be prepared and be aware of working for Jupiter Medical Center or is not as it seems!

review_title: Look elsewhere for a quality work environment
pros: Still have some great people working here who are committed to the mission of delivering quality of care to the community.
cons: Most unscrupulous team of executives you'll run across in the area. Yet despite their drag and 'overhead' the staff still manages to deliver quality care despite the poor working environment and underhanded politics. Massive number of frivolous terminations over the past 2-3 years. Those who remain work under constant fear or threat of termination sapping productivity and killing the working environment. Extremely low morale among employees across the organization. Company values has degraded severely over the past 3 years.

pros: The culture is great senior leadership is really supportive a very healthy envrionment to work in lots of changes but we understand if we do not change we can fail. The changes are exciting some people struggle with all the good stuff happening in the organization.
cons: Healthcare is changing the way we used to do things are not the same anymore and thats hard I wish it was the way it was.

pros: Good caring nurses that have been working very hard to provide care with what little we have just to care for the patients, which is why we are there.
cons: It used to be the best place to work until the new management took over. Now they staff nurses and then send them home during the night. Patients complain  all the time about the food, it's always cold and tastes bad. Staff quitting after 20 years of employment.

pros: Love the organization very nice people our senior leaders are real people who spend time with us and listen to us. We are going to miss the CEO he was a great guy and leader he cared about each team member.
cons: Lots of changes in surgical services lots of growth we need more staff its improving but we need a program that will attract and retain full time people. The growth is great but it can be frustrating.

pros: Great colleagues. Close to home.
cons: Poor increases in salary. No choice as to whether to work weekends or not.

pros: None- This is a case of from CEO down there is no real concern for patients it about the money. The money leadership can put in the pocket and how the organization looks on the balance sheet for the Board.
cons: So many to list. Horrible CEo that has perfected being polished on the outside but is a horrible person on the inside. No morals and values exist and this than flows down to CIO, CFO this team has perfected art of saying what they think you want to hear and never taking ownership of their decisions, Blame game!

pros: Nothing! I can't think of one thing that comes to mind!
cons: Horrible benefits, holidays come out of your own PDO time, there are no managers, directors don't assist, CEO is leaving-- enough said!

pros: It was the best feeling putting in my 2 weeks notice. A huge weight was taken off my shoulders, but even doing everything by the books, you still get treated like a peasant.
cons: Worked like a dog. Treated poorly. Nit picked about everything. Extremely abusive work environment. Worked as an insurance verification specialist. Was forced to do atleast 20 to 30+ patients daily. That's checking their benefits, creating their file and filling it up with all their paperwork and information, and then calling them to make sure everything is in their file is entered correctly,  make sure they know their benefits,  the cost of their visit and their appointment time and location as well as explain any preparation they may have.

review_title: Overworked and underpaid and under appreciated
